title: 'Should I run again?' Trump keeping talking about third term
shortDescription: Trump raised the topic of another term Thursday during a Black History Month event at the White House and during a speech to Republican governors.

title: Senate passes GOP border security bill without Trump tax cuts
shortDescription: The Senate passed a Republican bill promoting President Donald Trump's immigration, energy and defense policies in the early hours of Friday.

title: Trump wants NYCâ€™s congestion pricing dead. Will it be roadkill?
shortDescription: MTA head Janno Lieber said 1.2 million fewer vehicles went into Manhattan's central business district in January.

title: How Trump's federal employee cuts differ from Clinton's
shortDescription: Elon Musk compared Trump's mass firings to Clinton-era federal streamlining, but the architect of Clinton's plan says they're very different.

title: Hammer time: Trump's first month was just a preview, insiders say
shortDescription: Critics say the president is on a scorched earth campaign to raze the federal government. The White House says he's delivering for voters.

title: IRS fires 6,000 employees as Trump slashes US government
shortDescription: A tearful executive at the U.S. Internal Revenue Service told staffers on Thursday that about 6,000 employees would be fired.

title: White House hosts Black History Month
shortDescription: President Trump hosted a Black History Month event at the White House as his administration rolls back diversity, equity and inclusion programs.

title: Trump celebrates Black History Month after dropping diversity programs
shortDescription: Trump told a cheering crowd that he was fighting 'for Black Americans and all Americans' at a Black History Month reception at the White House.

title: Trump backs direct payments to Americans from savings generated by DOGE
shortDescription: President Trump backed an idea pitched to Elon Musk of sending checks of up to $5,000 to Americans if DOGE is able to cut federal government costs.

title: Trump's Social Security head contradicts claims about dead recipients
shortDescription: Even Trump's new top Social Security chief is refuting the president's claims that deceased Americans are receiving Social Security payments.

title: Trump vows to 'make sure' gold is at Fort Knox; Treasury Secretary says it is
shortDescription: Elon Musk was pushing for an audit of Fort Knox to make sure gold is still there. Donald Trump promised to do just that, but his Treasury Secretary says it's "present and accounted for."

title: Trump cuts to science, medicine will hurt everyone, researchers say
shortDescription: How much has been cut or halted remains unclear; the Trump administration has not released a comprehensive, reliable accounting.

title: More than 200 TSA workers fired by Trump administration
shortDescription: The TSA confirmed the terminations of 243 probationary workers, citing "performance and conduct issues" with the employees.

title: Sen. Mitch McConnell will not seek reelection in 2026
shortDescription: U.S. Sen. Mitch McConnell, after spent decades in the nation's Capitol shaping Republican priorities, will not seek reelection when his term expires.

title: Royal remark from President Trump sparks backlash
shortDescription: The White House posted a quote from Trump calling himself "king" with a fake Time Magazine cover.

title: After LA blazes, Trump terminates workers who help fight forest fires
shortDescription: The U.S. Forest Service fired 2,000 probationary workers. The agency says none were "operational firefighters," but some helped battle wildfires.

title: Trump 'not happy with Boeing' over Air Force One planes
shortDescription: The comments were the White House's latest attempt to ratchet up pressure on Boeing.

title: Trump calls Zelenskyy a 'dictator without elections' | The Excerpt
shortDescription: Plus: A judge holds off on deciding whether to drop a corruption case surrounding New York City Mayor Eric Adams. This and more on The Excerpt.

title: Trump says feds should 'take over' Washington D.C.
shortDescription: Citing crime and homelessness in the national capital, President Trump said he wants the federal government to "take over" and govern Washington D.C.
